job.name: SSH_Terminal_Via_Browser
job.description: Deploy a Wetty service to provide to users a SSH terminal via a web browser. This service requires as input: - INSTANCE_NAME: name of SSH service instance - TARGET_HOST: SSH target host, among the list of hosts managed by ProActive Resource Manager - SSH_PORT: port used by SSH in the TARGET_HOST - PROXYFIED: whether the service should be accessed via the ProActive server proxy (for restricted access control) The service takes further inputs as variable values when used with a native scheduler such as Slurm. In this case, it deploys a SSH terminal and reserves one or several hosts allocated by the underlying native scheduler. Those parameters are: - NATIVE_SCHEDULER: Target native scheduler (e.g., Slurm, PBS, etc) - NATIVE_SCHEDULER_PARAMS: Parameters needed to submit the job to the native scheduler

task.name: Start_Shell_Terminal
task.description: Pull Wetty image and start a container

script.code:
echo BEGIN "$variables_PA_TASK_NAME"
################################################################################ ### THIS PART IS IMAGE SPECIFIC. IF YOU NEED TO MODIFY SOMETHING, DO IT HERE ### # Check if the Linux machine supports AVX instructions DOCKER_IMAGE=svenihoney/wetty TERMINAL_INTERNAL_PORT=3000 INSTANCE_NAME=$variables_INSTANCE_NAME
if [ -z "$variables_TARGET_HOST" ] then TARGET_HOST=$variables_PA_NODE_HOST else TARGET_HOST=$variables_TARGET_HOST fi ################################################################################ GET_RANDOM_PORT(){ PCA_SERVICES_PORT_RANGE_FILE=$variables_PA_SCHEDULER_HOME/config/pca_services_port_range if [[ -f "$PCA_SERVICES_PORT_RANGE_FILE" ]]; then read LOWERPORT UPPERPORT < $PCA_SERVICES_PORT_RANGE_FILE else read LOWERPORT UPPERPORT < /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_local_port_range fi while : do RND_PORT="`shuf -i $LOWERPORT-$UPPERPORT -n 1`" ss -lpn | grep -q ":$RND_PORT " || break done echo $RND_PORT }
echo "Picking a random port number" TERMINAL_HOST_PORT=$(GET_RANDOM_PORT)
echo "[INFO] The service will be initialized on port $TERMINAL_HOST_PORT"
if [ -z "$INSTANCE_NAME" ]; then echo "[ERROR] The INSTANCE_NAME is not provided by the user. Empty value is not allowed." exit 1 fi
echo "Pulling "$variables_PA_JOB_NAME" image" docker pull $DOCKER_IMAGE
if [ "$(docker ps --format '{{.Names}}' | grep ^$INSTANCE_NAME$)" ]; then RUNNING=$(docker inspect --format="{{ .State.Running }}" $INSTANCE_NAME 2> /dev/null) STOPPED=$(docker inspect --format="{{ .State.Status }}" $INSTANCE_NAME 2> /dev/null) if [ "${RUNNING,,}" = "true" ]; then echo "$INSTANCE_NAME container is running" elif [ "${STOPPED,,}" = "exited" ]; then echo "Starting $INSTANCE_NAME container" docker start $INSTANCE_NAME fi else echo "Running $INSTANCE_NAME container" echo docker run -d --name $INSTANCE_NAME -p $TERMINAL_HOST_PORT:$TERMINAL_INTERNAL_PORT -e REMOTE_SSH_SERVER=$TARGET_HOST -e REMOTE_SSH_PORT=$variables_SSH_PORT $DOCKER_IMAGE docker run -d --name $INSTANCE_NAME -p $TERMINAL_HOST_PORT:$TERMINAL_INTERNAL_PORT -e REMOTE_SSH_SERVER=$TARGET_HOST -e REMOTE_SSH_PORT=$variables_SSH_PORT $DOCKER_IMAGE fi
TERMINAL_PORT=$(docker inspect --format='{{(index (index .NetworkSettings.Ports "'$TERMINAL_INTERNAL_PORT'/tcp") 0).HostPort}}' $INSTANCE_NAME) echo "$TERMINAL_PORT" > $INSTANCE_NAME"_port"
containerID=$(docker ps -aqf "name=^$INSTANCE_NAME$") echo "$containerID" > $INSTANCE_NAME"_containerID"
echo END "$variables_PA_TASK_NAME"
